Params: {3: "The crimson spiral tower collapses and rebuilds again and again at the edge of Lee's vision."}
{3: 'As the relevant modules activate, time and space begin shifting from abstraction into something real.'}
{3: 'Crimson threads coil around his body, weaving together countless possibilities.'}
{3: 'They unravel at each juncture, only to braid into something new, shaping a different future.'}
{3: 'Some events are connected to him; others are not.'}
{3: "Some are from his perspective; others are from <phonetic=Commandant's>someone else's</phonetic>."}
{3: 'Who has been watching them all along, and who...'}
{3: 'Golden specks of light leap through the tunnel of time.'}
{3: "Lee's focus suddenly sharpens as he reaches out, grasping toward that radiant light—"}
{3: 'The distorted vision disappears, vanishing like a receding tide.'}
{3: 'His M.I.N.D. churns with almost unbearable pain. In a daze, he glimpses the universe and the starry sky.'}
{3: "He's surprised to realize that the unfamiliar sky feels strangely familiar."}
{3: 'Chaotic whispers echo in his ears. He can only wait, helpless, for the surge to pass...'}
{3: 'Familiar golden light flickers in the space around him.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'His scattered consciousness pulls together again. Lee forces his eyes open, blinking toward a vague figure standing in front of him.'}
{3: "Lee draws his weapon on reflex, but the moment he sees what's in front of him, he falls silent."}
{1: '1', 3: "It's a Construct that looks exactly like him.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Their gazes meet—past perceptions align, possibilities flash through his mind, and Lee arrives at the conclusion with ease.'}
{3: 'The galaxy rotates slowly. They seem to be standing at the window of a ship.'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: "I'm you, from ▂▇ years in the future.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'The sound of the number is muffled, as if intentionally erased, but Lee can still make out part of it from the way his lips move.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "...I was in Dead Zone ▇ on a mission. I didn't see any entrance, gateway structures, or landmarks.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "I'm not sure how I got here either.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'His words are also blurred by some unknown force, but Lee knows the other him understands.'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: "...That Dead Zone number... That can't be right. The Hetero Tower isn't located there.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'He has never heard of this term. But just like that starry sky, it feels strangely familiar, as if his life has tangled with it countless times before.'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: "You haven't seen it? It's a... No, never mind. If you'd seen it, you'd know what it is.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "I haven't, but I might have heard of something like it. Maybe the same thing, under a different name.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Did you see something? Like... the "visions" you had before?', 4: '1'}
{3: "They don't name who they mean. But they both understand."}
{3: 'If 【kuroname】 is involved, what kind of price would it take to erase something that means so much to his future self?'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "What's happening ▂▇ years from now? What is this place?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: '...You still have the luxury of asking that. Must be nice.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The voice of the other Lee suddenly softens, carrying a hint of exhaustion.'}
{3: "He doesn't finish the question. He already knows the answer."}
{3: 'The Hyperreal frame, a design that transcends time and space, includes modules that simulate evolutionary paths.'}
{3: 'All he needs from his other self is the prerequisites and key parameters. After that...'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: '▂▇ years from now... the commandant will <color=#ff4e4eff>die</color>.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'Commandant and Lucia will both die because of the Hetero Tower.', 4: '18'}
{3: 'His own voice sounds beside his ear, like narration from a story.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: "On day 1825 after the commandant's disappearance, the <color=#ff4e4eff>Hetero Zone</color> erupted. The Red Tide spread to every corner of the world.", 4: '18'}

{2: 'Lee?', 3: "We tried countless times to re-enter the Hetero Tower. But we were always kept out. Then the mutated Red Tide poured out from within and swallowed the world. And I couldn't stop it...", 4: '18'}
{3: "Lee looks down at his other self's hands."}
{3: "The knuckles are stained with rust. It's clear this frame hasn't been maintained in a long time."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: 'All I could do was land again and again. Keep trying to get close to the Hetero Tower. And get turned away. Again and again.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: "Why wasn't it me who entered? Why wasn't I the one who died? Why wasn't I the one who left?", 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'Every minute... every second... I kept asking myself those questions.', 4: '18'}

{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'Why was I able to rewrite the core of the Hetero Tower, but still failed to save the ones who mattered most? Why was I left standing outside the Hetero Tower, staring at that empty gateway?', 4: '18'}
{3: 'His voice is calm. But anyone could hear the grief behind it.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: 'On day 5475... after the commandant and Lucia entered the Hetero Tower... we waited <color=#ff4e4eff>5475 days, 4 hours, and 18 minutes</color>.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'We waited <color=#ff4e4eff>5,475 days, 4 hours, 18 minutes, and 09 seconds</color>, until humanity could barely survive on Earth.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'Babylonia left orbit and fled into deep space.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'We considered staying, hoping to find Commandant and Lucia again, but...', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'Maybe deep space was the only place left to search for the future.', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: "I don't know if it was the right choice. But there's no going back now.", 4: '18'}
{3: 'The vision ends. They return to the present.'}
{3: "Lee stays silent. He doesn't know how to respond."}
{3: 'If it were him, what would he choose? Leave Earth behind to chase a future among the stars? Or stay behind, guarding a dead planet, waiting for a miracle?'}
{3: "He doesn't know. And he doesn't want to know."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'So... it was that person who rewrote the future...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'To rewrite the future—what kind of price would that take?'}
{3: "Everything about that person's state not long ago now seems to have an answer."}
{3: 'Stumbling back into the lounge... collapsing the moment when seeing them...'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: "We gave everything we had and still couldn't change the past. I can't imagine the pain and loneliness that person must've endured to make it happen.", 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '4', 7: '3'}
{3: "Countless memories flood into Lee's M.I.N.D. His pupils dilate as he taps into the computing power of countless versions of himself, reaching across all pasts and futures."}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'Even after venturing into deep space, I kept testing the limits of this frame—until I reached the farthest depths of my own M.I.N.D.', 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '4', 7: '3'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'We have always been looking for the "right path," and eliminating every self that has gone astray.', 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '4', 7: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: 'This frame carries every failure, every death. It belongs to the past and the future.', 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '3'}
{3: 'Space twists in on itself, then folds outward again. The figure before him—Lee—shifts, one form after another.'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: 'You are the luckiest one, and also the unluckiest one.', 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '3'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: "You <color=#ff4e4eff>can't take</color> any of the future with you. But you still have all the possibilities.", 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: "The loop's been broken. It's time for you to go.", 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '4', 7: '3'}
{3: 'He stands inside his own M.I.N.D., staring down countless versions of himself.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee?', 3: 'We are you. And you are us.', 4: '5'}
{3: 'Within his M.I.N.D., that glowing Mind Beacon pulses—quiet and steady'}
{3: 'That voice travels from the distant past to the present.'}
{3: 'From the present, it moves forward into the future.'}
{3: 'Pain from M.I.N.D. overload tears through his body. A suffocating weight grips his throat.'}
{3: 'He seems to be absorbing endless information, and yet sees nothing at all.'}
{3: 'From a forgotten communication terminal nearby, a familiar voice keeps calling his name.'}
{2: 'Your M.I.N.D. connection suddenly cut off. Is everything okay?', 3: '379'}
{3: "As he regathers his mind from scattered fragments, Lee's fists tighten."}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Please... wait for me to come back.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The transport ship slices through the clouds, racing back toward Babylonia at top speed.'}
{3: 'The door to the Gray Raven lounge remains closed, as always.'}
{3: 'Lee stands in front of it. His fingers tremble slightly.'}
{3: 'In the blur of his "memories," he remembers flinging this door open countless times, hoping to find that familiar human inside.'}
{3: 'But each time, all he saw was an empty room and a chair that held no warmth.'}
{3: "There's no time to question where those memories came from. He presses his palm firmly to the door."}
{3: 'The door suddenly swings open from the inside. It catches Lee off guard—he nearly stumbles.'}
{3: 'But he steadies himself just in time.'}
{2: 'Lee?', 3: '414', 4: "Why didn't you open the door?", 5: '414', 6: '(Grab Lee)', 7: '414'}
{3: 'Without warning, he grips your hand. Warmth floods from your palm into his M.I.N.D.'}
{3: "Before you can ask what's wrong, Lee suddenly pulls you into a tight embrace."}
{3: 'Warm light spills throughout the room, and the commandant sits in that usual seat, calm and steady.'}
{2: 'Why did the M.I.N.D. connection break so suddenly...', 3: '433'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Before the question can be asked, Lee grabs your arm tightly, as if trying to be sure of something.'}
{3: "His cold fingers slowly warm. Only after confirming you're truly safe does Lee finally exhale."}
{3: "He seems to understand now—why you had rushed back to the lounge that day. Why they had kept checking on everyone's frame conditions."}
{3: "But... that's all in the past now."}
{3: 'The memory fragments fade with time. The despair is wiped away by the light. Dawn begins to color the world again.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "It's just... something this frame does. A special function.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Since when are you this honest?', 3: '447', 4: 'Do you need to get a checkup at the Science Council?', 5: '452'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "I promised I wouldn't keep secrets from you anymore. If you want to know something, and I know it, I'll tell you.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Then... do you need to get a checkup at the Science Council?', 3: '452'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Yeah. And if you have time, could you come with me?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'His invitation comes out awkward, but sincere.'}
{3: 'On the way to the Science Council, warm sunlight spills across the path.'}
{2: "So the connection broke because of your frame's special function again?", 3: '462'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "Yes. I believe it happened because I was pushing the frame to full capacity. In an overloaded state, I couldn't keep the M.I.N.D. connection stable.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'When I was overloaded... I think I saw a tower.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Something stirs inside you at those words.'}
{3: 'A faint scene stretches across your vision. At the edge of your sight, a blood-red tower stands tall, glowing ominously.'}
{3: 'But the "vision" is too vague. No clear signs. No real answers.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Just... this strange feeling. Like I've been through something before. But I don't remember any of it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I pulled all the frame data from that time. It only shows a few seconds of M.I.N.D. overload.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The fluctuations look a lot like what we see during a consciousness transfer. But there are subtle differences.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'All I can say for sure is that your M.I.N.D. is full of locked data shards. What they are? No one knows.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'What if we try a Deep M.I.N.D. connection...', 3: '495'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Not advised. Forcing open locked data like that is risky. Lee's M.I.N.D. might become unstable.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I've limited its computing capacity for now. That should prevent anything similar from happening again.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "As for the real answer... maybe we'll find it eventually.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Asimov looks at you with a meaningful expression.'}
{3: 'With that abrupt remark, he leaves the lab with Rosa.'}
{3: 'Late at night, a few scattered stars hang over the artificial sky.'}
{3: 'Lee sits at his desk, staring at a blank message on the terminal. The recipient field is already filled in.'}
{3: 'The memories from the M.I.N.D. overload blur like morning dew—fragile, faint. But a voice keeps pushing him...'}
{3: '"We\'ll never know what you need if you never say a thing."'}
{3: '"And there are things that can go unnoticed if you always choose to be quiet about them."'}
{3: 'He remembers what the commandant once told him.'}
{3: "So now... It's his turn to take that step."}
{3: 'His fingers start typing—clumsy at first, then more fluid. As the morning star rises, he adds the final period.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "With nothing else changing, the Hetero Tower won't appear any time soon.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'Lee has lost the chance to enter it—and with it, his right to ascend.', 4: '1'}
{3: "But maybe the Construct doesn't need that path to ascend anymore."}
{3: 'In the distant future, Lee might still step into the Hetero Tower. He might still climb that ladder.'}
{3: "No matter what happens, when that time comes, he won't face it alone."}
